Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Isracidin  (natural AMPs; cattle, ruminant, mammals; animals; VIHNN; Derivatives: Caseicin A; Caseicin B)

Literature Information.Literature: Generated from caseins by proteases (?). Active against E. coli DH5alpha or DPC6053 (MIC 0.2 mg/ml) and E. sakazakii (MIC 0.5 mg/ml). Both segments IKHQGLPQE (Caseicin A) and VLNENLLR (Caseicin B) were reported previously to be active (Casein-derived antimicrobial peptides generated by Lactobacillus acidophilus DPC6026. Appl Environ Microbiol. 2006 Mar;72(3):2260-4). Updated 6/2023
Literature Information.Author: Birkemo GA, O'Sullivan O, Ross RP, Hill C2009
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial activity of two peptides casecidin 15 and 17, found naturally in bovine colostrum
